Package space.sunqian.common.io

Interface ByteIOOperator

All Known Subinterfaces:
IOOperator
@ThreadSafe public interface ByteIOOperator
This interface provides I/O operations for byte.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default byte @Nullable []
    available(@Nonnull InputStream src)
    Reads available data from the input stream into a new array, continuing until no data is immediately available, and returns the array.
    default byte @Nullable []

    Reads a specified length of data from the input stream into a new array, and returns the array.

    Reads available data from the source channel into a new buffer, continuing until no data is immediately available, and returns the buffer.

    availableString(@Nonnull InputStream src)
    Reads available data from the input stream as a string with CharsKit.defaultCharset(), continuing until no data is immediately available, and returns the string.

    Reads available data from the input stream as a string with the specified charset, continuing until no data is immediately available, and returns the string.

    default int
    availableTo(@Nonnull InputStream src, byte @Nonnull [] dst)
    Reads available data from the input stream into the destination array, until the read number reaches the array's length or no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of bytes read to.
    default int
    availableTo(@Nonnull InputStream src, byte @Nonnull [] dst, int off, int len)
    Reads a specified length of data from the input stream into the destination array, starting at the specified offset, until the read number reaches the specified length or no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of bytes read to.
    default long

    Reads available data from the input stream into the output stream, until no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of bytes read to.

    default int

    Reads available data from the input stream into the destination buffer, until reaches the end of the buffer or no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of bytes read to.

  • Method Details

    • bufferSize

      int bufferSize()
      Returns the buffer size for I/O operations.
      Returns:
      the buffer size for I/O operations

    • read

      default byte @Nullable [] read(@Nonnull @Nonnull InputStream src) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads all data from the input stream into a new array, continuing until reaches the end of the input stream, and returns the array.

      If reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read, returns null.

      Parameters:
      src - the input stream
      Returns:
      a new array containing the read data, or null if reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • read

      default byte @Nullable [] read(@Nonnull @Nonnull InputStream src, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the input stream into a new array, and returns the array. If the specified length is 0, returns an empty array without reading. Otherwise, this method keeps reading until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the input stream.

      If reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read, returns null.

      Note this method will allocate a new array with the specified length, and the excessive length may cause out of memory.

      Parameters:
      src - the input stream
      len - the specified read length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      a new array containing the read data, or null if reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • read

      @Nullable default @Nullable ByteBuffer read(@Nonnull @Nonnull ReadableByteChannel src) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads all data from the source channel into a new buffer, continuing until reaches the end of the source channel, and returns the buffer. The new buffer's position is 0 and limit equals its capacity.

      If reaches the end of the source channel and no data is read, returns null.

      Parameters:
      src - the source channel
      Returns:
      a new buffer containing the read data, or null if reaches the end of the source channel and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • read

      @Nullable default @Nullable ByteBuffer read(@Nonnull @Nonnull ReadableByteChannel src, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the source channel into a new buffer, and returns the buffer. If the specified length is 0, returns an empty buffer without reading. Otherwise, this method keeps reading until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the source channel. The new buffer's position is 0 and limit equals its capacity.

      If reaches the end of the source channel and no data is read, returns null.

      Note this method will allocate a new array with the specified length, and the excessive length may cause out of memory.

      Parameters:
      src - the source channel
      len - the specified read length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      a new buffer containing the read data, or null if reaches the end of the source channel and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

      If reaches the end of the source channel and no data is read, returns null.

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      a new array containing the read data, or null if reaches the end of the source channel and no data is read

    • readBytes

      default byte @Nullable [] readBytes(@Nonnull @Nonnull ReadableByteChannel src, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the source channel into a new array, and returns the array. If the specified length is 0, returns an empty array without reading. Otherwise, this method keeps reading until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the source channel.

      If reaches the end of the source channel and no data is read, returns null.

      Note this method will allocate a new array with the specified length, and the excessive length may cause out of memory.

      Parameters:
      src - the source channel
      len - the specified read length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      a new array containing the read data, or null if reaches the end of the source channel and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readTo

      default long readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull InputStream src, @Nonnull @Nonnull OutputStream dst) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads data from the input stream into the output stream, until reaches the end of the input stream, and returns the actual number of bytes read to.

      If reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read, returns -1.

      Parameters:
      src - the input stream
      dst - the output stream
      Returns:
      the actual number of bytes read to, or -1 if reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readTo

      default long readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull InputStream src, @Nonnull @Nonnull OutputStream dst, long len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the input stream into the output stream, until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the input stream, returns the actual number of bytes read to.

      If the specified length is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read, returns -1.

      Parameters:
      src - the input stream
      dst - the output stream
      len - the specified length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      the actual number of bytes read to, or -1 if reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readTo

      default int readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull InputStream src, byte @Nonnull [] dst) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads data from the input stream into the destination array, until the read number reaches the array's length or reaches the end of the input stream, and returns the actual number of bytes read to.

      If the array's length is 0, returns 0 without reading. If reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read, returns -1.

      Parameters:
      src - the input stream
      dst - the destination array
      Returns:
      the actual number of bytes read to, or -1 if reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readTo

      default int readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull InputStream src, byte @Nonnull [] dst, int off, int len) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the input stream into the destination array, starting at the specified offset, until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the input stream, and returns the actual number of bytes read to.

      If the specified length is 0, returns 0 without reading. If reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read, returns -1.

      Parameters:
      src - the input stream
      dst - the destination array
      off - the specified offset of the array
      len - the specified length to read
      Returns:
      the actual number of bytes read to, or -1 if reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the arguments are out of bounds
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readTo

      default int readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull InputStream src, @Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer dst) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads data from the input stream into the destination buffer, until reaches the end of the stream or buffer, and returns the actual number of bytes read to.

      If the destination buffer's remaining is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read, returns -1.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      src - the input stream
      dst - the destination buffer
      Returns:
      the actual number of bytes read to, or -1 if reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readTo

      default int readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull InputStream src, @Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer dst, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the input stream into the destination buffer, until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the stream or buffer, and returns the actual number of bytes read to.

      If the specified length or destination buffer's remaining is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read, returns -1.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      src - the input stream
      dst - the specified buffer
      len - the specified length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      the actual number of bytes read to, or -1 if reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readTo

      If reaches the end of the input channel and no data is read, returns -1.

      Parameters:

      dst - the output stream
      Returns:
      the actual number of bytes read to, or -1 if reaches the end of the input channel and no data is read

      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

      Reads a specified length of data from the source channel into the destination array, starting at the specified offset, until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the source channel, and returns the actual number of bytes read to.

      If the specified length is 0, returns 0 without reading. If reaches the end of the source channel and no data is read, returns -1.

      dst - the destination array
      off - the specified offset of the array
      len - the specified length to read

      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the arguments are out of bounds
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readTo

      default int readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull ReadableByteChannel src, @Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer dst) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads data from the source channel into the destination buffer, until reaches the end of the stream or buffer, and returns the actual number of bytes read to.

      If the destination buffer's remaining is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of the source channel and no data is read, returns -1.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      src - the source channel
      dst - the destination buffer
      Returns:
      the actual number of bytes read to, or -1 if reaches the end of the source channel and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readTo

      default int readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull ReadableByteChannel src, @Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer dst, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the source channel into the destination buffer, until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the stream or buffer, and returns the actual number of bytes read to.

      If the specified length or destination buffer's remaining is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of the source channel and no data is read, returns -1.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      src - the source channel
      dst - the specified buffer
      len - the specified length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      the actual number of bytes read to, or -1 if reaches the end of the source channel and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • available

      default byte @Nullable [] available(@Nonnull @Nonnull InputStream src) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads available data from the input stream into a new array, continuing until no data is immediately available, and returns the array.

      If reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read, returns null.

      Parameters:
      src - the input stream
      Returns:
      a new array containing the read data, possibly empty, or null if reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • available

      default byte @Nullable [] available(@Nonnull @Nonnull InputStream src, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the input stream into a new array, and returns the array. If the specified length is 0, returns an empty array without reading. Otherwise, this method keeps reading until the read number reaches the specified length or no data is immediately available.

      If reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read, returns null.

      Note this method will allocate a new array with the specified length, and the excessive length may cause out of memory.

      Parameters:
      src - the input stream
      len - the specified read length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      a new array containing the read data, possibly empty, or null if reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • available

      @Nullable default @Nullable ByteBuffer available(@Nonnull @Nonnull ReadableByteChannel src) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads available data from the source channel into a new buffer, continuing until no data is immediately available, and returns the buffer. The new buffer's position is 0 and limit equals its capacity.

      If reaches the end of the source channel and no data is read, returns null.

      Parameters:
      src - the source channel
      Returns:
      a new buffer containing the read data, possibly empty, or null if reaches the end of the source channel and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

      Reads a specified length of data from the input stream into the destination array, starting at the specified offset, until the read number reaches the specified length or no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of bytes read to.

      If the specified length is 0, returns 0 without reading. If reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read, returns -1.

      Parameters:

      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the arguments are out of bounds

    • availableTo

      default int availableTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull InputStream src, @Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer dst) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads available data from the input stream into the destination buffer, until reaches the end of the buffer or no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of bytes read to.

      If the destination buffer's remaining is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read, returns -1.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      src - the input stream
      dst - the destination buffer
      Returns:
      the actual number of bytes read to, possibly 0, or -1 if reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • availableTo

      default int availableTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull InputStream src, @Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer dst, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the input stream into the destination buffer, until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the buffer or no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of bytes read to.

      If the specified length or destination buffer's remaining is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read, returns -1.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      src - the input stream
      dst - the specified buffer
      len - the specified length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      the actual number of bytes read to, possibly 0, or -1 if reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs
